## GLM 

create x, y

```{r}
N <- 1e2
#x1 <- rbinom(n = N, 1, 0.3)
x1 <- runif(n = 1e2, min = 0, max = 2)
b0 <- 0.1
b1 <- 1.0

theta <- arm::invlogit(b0 + (b1 * x1))
y <- rep(NA, N);
for (i in 1:N) {
    y[i] = rbinom(1, 1, theta[i]);
}
df <- data.frame(y, x1)
df
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(df, aes(x1, y)) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.5) 
```

```{r}
model <- glm(y ~ x1, data = df, family = binomial(link = "logit"))
summary(model)
```
